intro: Gyminda fimbrillata, commonly known as the silky hair-plant, is a unique species of liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Pottiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery appearance. The plant has a thalloid structure with a smooth, green upper surface and a darker, often reddish underside. Gyminda fimbrillata thrives in rocky or soil-covered areas, often in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures are small and inconspicuous, typical of many bryophytes.
